modelisation.builder.strategies

Interface SplittingStrategy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChiSquared, ClassificationError, EntropyReduction, GiniImpurity, RandomSplittingStrategy, VarianceReduction

    public interface SplittingStrategy
    Responsible for implementing algorithms to choose the best way to split a given dataset in order to predict a target column. This class is used together with DecisionTreeBuilder to train decision (i.e. classification/regression) trees on some given dataset.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

      Choose the best split from a collection of splits scored by evaluateSplit(Column, Column).
      double chooseSplitValue(Column targetColumn, Column splitColumn)
      For a continous-valued column that needs to be reduced to a discrete-valued column, choose an appropriate value to split on.
      double evaluateSplit(Column targetColumn, Column splitColumn)
      Return a score for the possible prediction accuracy gains against `targetColumn` by introducing a splitter node on the given `splitColumn`.
      double evaluateSplit(Column targetColumn, Column splitColumn, double splitValue)
      Return a score for the possible prediction accuracy gains against `targetColumn` by introducing a splitter node on the given `splitColumn` at the threshold value splitValue.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Human-readable name for this strategy.

      Shortcut for choosing the highest element from a collection according to some score.

      Shortcut for choosing the lowest element from a collection according to some score.

      Return true if this splitting strategy works against the given column.

    • Method Detail

      • max

        static <S> S max(java.util.Collection<? extends S> splits,
                 java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction<S> scorer)
        Shortcut for choosing the highest element from a collection according to some score. Same signature as chooseBestSplit(Collection, ToDoubleFunction).

      • min

        static <S> S min(java.util.Collection<? extends S> splits,
                 java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction<S> scorer)
        Shortcut for choosing the lowest element from a collection according to some score. Same signature as chooseBestSplit(Collection, ToDoubleFunction).

      • chooseBestSplit

        <S> S chooseBestSplit(java.util.Collection<? extends S> splits,
                      java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction<S> score)
        Choose the best split from a collection of splits scored by evaluateSplit(Column, Column).

        The score returned by evaluateSplit(Column, Column) is accesible via score(S).

        Type Parameters:
        S - type of split
        Parameters:
        splits - a collection of possible splits to be compared; must not be empty
        score - functor to extract the score from a split
        Returns:
        the best scoring split

      • evaluateSplit

        double evaluateSplit(Column targetColumn,
                     Column splitColumn)
        Return a score for the possible prediction accuracy gains against `targetColumn` by introducing a splitter node on the given `splitColumn`.
        Parameters:
        targetColumn - column containing the values to classify/predict
        splitColumn - column containing discrete values to make a split decision on; splitColumn.isDiscrete() must return true
        Returns:
        a split score as interpreted by chooseBestSplit(Collection, ToDoubleFunction)
        See Also:
        evaluateSplit(Column, Column, double)

      • evaluateSplit

        double evaluateSplit(Column targetColumn,
                     Column splitColumn,
                     double splitValue)
        Return a score for the possible prediction accuracy gains against `targetColumn` by introducing a splitter node on the given `splitColumn` at the threshold value splitValue.
        Parameters:
        targetColumn - column containing the values to classify/predict
        splitColumn - column containing discrete values to make a split decision on; splitColumn.isDiscrete() must return false
        Returns:
        a split score as interpreted by chooseBestSplit(Collection, ToDoubleFunction)
        See Also:
        evaluateSplit(Column, Column)

      • chooseSplitValue

        double chooseSplitValue(Column targetColumn,
                        Column splitColumn)
        For a continous-valued column that needs to be reduced to a discrete-valued column, choose an appropriate value to split on.

        A column is reduced by choosing a value to split on, and classing the column in two categories - below the split value and equal or above the split value.

        Parameters:
        targetColumn - the column to be predicted
        splitColumn - continuous column to be split; splitColumn.isDiscrete() must return false
        Returns:
        desired split value

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Human-readable name for this strategy.
        Returns:
        human readable name

      • supportsTarget

        boolean supportsTarget(Column targetColumn)
        Return true if this splitting strategy works against the given column.
        Parameters:
        targetColumn - column to be predicted
        Returns:
        true if targetColumn is supported
